title: Nest, Axios, React, React-Native Architecture Speedrun
description: We see how fast we can put together React and React-Native applications that talk through a shared custom hook with Axios to talk to a NestJS backend.

title: Typescript NX Monorepo with NextJS and Express
description: Let's build an NX monorepo with an express API that shares Typescript types with a NextJS applications that we then test with Cypress. So much to learn and do, let's get into it!

title: No BS TS #33 - Viewer's Q&A (Does Typescript Bloat Code?)
description: Like any good tech series, this "season" ends with a Q&A where I answer a bunch of your questions that I have not yet answered.

title: No BS TS #32 - Monorepos with NX
description: We create a mono-repo to share components with an application using NX in just a few minutes.

title: No BS TS #31 - Testing with Jest and Wallaby
description: We use the ts-jest library to add unit tests to our code and then check out the insanely cool Wallaby extension for real time unit testing.

title: No BS TS #30 - Project setup
description: We set up a Typescript project for development and build, and connect it to a Javascript consumer and a Typescript consumer.

title: No BS TS #29 - Typescript/React - Using xState
description: We try out a Finite State Machine approach to state management by porting our Todo example to xState.

title: No BS TS #28 - Typescript/React - Zustand
description: Lets check out Zustand, a light weight state manager with that is immutable like Redux, and has great type safety.

title: No BS TS #27 -Typescript/React - Redux Toolkit
description: We get into the OG React state manager, Redux, and look how to use it with Redux Toolkit and keep it typed with Typescript.

title: No BS TS #26 - Typescript/React - Global State
description: We continue our look into global state management with Typescript by using a custom global state hook from react-use.

title: No BS TS #25 - Typescript/React - useContext
description: We start off exploring global state management by having a look at useContext and how to properly use and type it.

title: No BS TS #24 - Typescript/React - Generic Components
description: Let's fuse together our understanding of Typescript generics with what we know about writing React with Typescript and create a generic list component!

title: No BS TS #23 - Typescript/React - Custom Hooks
description: Let's delve deeper into React to see how to build and type our own custom hooks.

title: No BS TS #22 - Typescript/React - Advanced Properties
description: We figure out the right way to send state setting actions to nested components. As well as how to wrap html elements with all the appropriate properties using DetailedHTMLProps.

title: No BS TS #21 - Typescript/React - Hooks
description: Let's see how to type useState, useReducer, useEffect and useCallback.

title: No BS TS #20 - Typescript/React - Setup and Properties
description: Let's check out how Typescript works in React by setting up a Create React App (CRA) project with a Typescript template and then investigate how to do properties in Typescript.

title: Pokemon/React Viewer Projects
description: Let's take a live look at viewer submitted Pokemon viewer applications, and if we run out of those I can answer your questions about React, Fower, Typescript what have you.

title: No BS TS #19 - Utility Types in Typescript - Part 2
description: Turns out you can define types conditionally based on the a type check against a different type. Let's try it out on a fetch function that optionally takes a callback and can return either a void or a promise based on that callback.

title: No BS TS #18 - Conditional Types in Typescript
description: Turns out you can define types conditionally based on the type check against a different type. Let's try it out on a fetch function that optionally takes a callback and can return either a void or a promise based on that callback.

title: No BS TS - Challenge 3
description: Let's challenge ourselves to make an event processing engine using generics and mapped types.

title: No BS TS #17 - Mixins in Typescript
description: Let's check out how to have functions create functions, have functions create classes including using generics, and have them extend classes using mixins.

title: No BS TS #16 - Abstract Classes in Typescript
description: Let's see how and why we might use abstract classes in Typescript as we model Street Fighters.

title: No BS TS #15 - Readonly and Static in Typescript Classes
description: We can make fields in Typescript classes readonly, as well as make member fields and methods static. Let's explore some practical uses for readonly and static in classes.

title: Pokemon Page with React, Fower and Custom Hooks - Part 2
description: We finish off our Pokemon search page using Fower and Custom Hooks.

title: No BS TS #14 - Mapped Types in Typescript
description: Let's use that amazing keyof operator to pull off even crazier types by creating mapped types in Typescript.

title: No BS TS #13 - Generics in Typescript Classes
description: Let's take our Database implementation from episode 12 and make it generic!

title: No BS TS #12 - Typescript Classes; Member Visibility and Implements
description: Let's have a look at member visibility and how to implement interfaces in Typescript.

title: No BS TS #11 - Enums and Literal Types in Typescript
description: Lets export enumerations and literal types in Typescript and show how they can make your code safer.

title: Pokemon Page with React, Fower and Custom Hooks
description: Let's create a Pokemon search application using React, Fower, React hooks and a custom hook!

title: No BS TS #10 - Readonly And Immutability in Typescript
description: Lets cover how to make interface fields and tuples readonly as well as how to make truly constant arrays!

title: No BS TS #9 - Typescript Utility Types
description: Lets take our first, but definitely not last look at Utility types in Typescript. Including Partial, Required, Pick, Record, and Omit.

title: Mastering Typescript State using Valtio
description: Continuing on with Typescript we are starting a series on React state management where we take the same To-Do list and implement it using a bunch of different state managers. This time we are looking at Valtio!

title: No BS TS #8 - Generics with keyof in Typescript
description: The keyof operator in the generics context is as powerful as it is cool. Once you get the hang of it you are going to make some great APIs that are both easy to use and inherently type safe. You are going to fall in love with this Typescript operator.

title: No BS TS Challenge #2
description: Let's challenge ourselves to re-implement forEach, map and filter using reduce, and to do it in a type safe manner using Typescript.

title: No BS TS #7 - Generics in Typescript
description: Generics are fundamental to Typescript. So let's start digging in and learning this super powerful way of making your code cleaner, leaner and more type safe.

title: No BS TS #6 - Tuples in Typescript
description: Tuples are typed arrays in Typescript. Let's learn how to declare them, created them, and make our own version of useState.

title: No BS TS #5 - Optionals in Typescript
description: Understanding optional parameters, fields and calls is critical to writing great Typescript. Let's dig in and have a look at all these flavors of optionals, plus optional chaining, the null coalescing operator, and the `!` operator.

title: No BS TS #4 - Function Overloading in Typescript
description: Let's cover one of Typescript least known features; Function Overloading, and just because it's lesser known doesn't mean it's any less imoprtant.

title: No BS TS - Challenge #1
description: Let's see if you can take on a challenge with your new Typescript superpowers.

title: No BS TS #3 - Typescript Functions with Functions
description: Let's look at how to define Typescript functions take functions as parameters or return functions.

title: No BS TS #2 - Typescript Functions
description: Let's dig into defining Typescript functions and cover the #1 misconception that programmers have about Typescript.

title: No BS TS #1 - Typescript Setup & Everyday Types
description: Let's skip the chatter and get right into Typescript, why you should use it, how to set it up and how to start typing your variables.

title: Mastering Typescript State with Galactic State
description: We continue our series on state management with React and Typescript, this time using Galactic State and react-hooks-global-state.

title: Introduction To React #17 | Static Site Generation (SSG)
description: We statically generate the Pokemon detail page using NextJS' Static Site Generation (SSG) functionality.

title: Live! Common React Mistakes: useEffect - Part 2
description: Let's build on part 1 (https://youtu.be/lStfMBiWROQ) by looking at the cleanup function on useEffect to make sure that we are using timeouts, intervals and registering event listeners properly.

title: Common React Mistakes: useEffect - Part 2
description: Let's build on part 1 (https://youtu.be/lStfMBiWROQ) by looking at the cleanup function on useEffect to make sure that we are using timeouts, intervals and registering event listeners properly.

title: Live! Common React Mistakes: useEffect
description: Let's work through some common mistakes when using React's useEffect, useCallback and useMemo hooks (or not using them), and also their tricky dependency arrays. We will even come up with a helpful list of rules to live by. And we will do it all live so that you can ask questions as we go!

title: Common React Mistakes: useEffect - Part 1
description: Let's work through some common mistakes when using React's useEffect, useCallback and useMemo hooks (or not using them), and also their tricky dependency arrays. We will even come up with a helpful list of rules to live by.

title: Three Patterns for Type Safe Analytics using Typescript
description: Let's improve our analytics code using Typescript and trying three different methods. Demonstrating Typescript features like; keyof, function overloading and closures.

title: Three Patterns for Type Safe Analytics using Typescript
description: Let's improve our analytics code using Typescript and trying three different methods. Demonstrating Typescript features like; keyof, function overloading and closures.

title: Typescript for React and Jotai From Beginners to Masters
description: Continuing on with Typescript we are starting a series on React state management where we take the same To-Do list and implement it using a bunch of different state managers. This time we are looking at Jotai!

title: Five Essential Design Patterns in Typescript
description:
I'm going to "do it live!" as I bring you five essential Design Patterns, from the GoF book, in Typescript, live, as you get to ask questions along the way! Super exciting, I can't wait to see how it turns out!

One thing I can guarantee is that you will come away from this with a decent idea of what these patterns are and code that you can reuse in your applications.

title: Typescript for React and Effector From Beginners to Masters
description: Continuing on with Typescript we are starting a series on React state management where we take the same To-Do list and implement it using a bunch of different state managers. This time we are looking at Effector!

title: Live Typescript Double Header - Learn MobX AND Create an SVG Lava Animation
description: Go from beginner to master on Typescript for MobX and then, in a double header, also learn about how to animate SVGs in React with custom hooks that we will build together.

title: Typescript for React and MobX From Beginners to Masters
description: Continuing on with Typescript we are starting a series on React state management where we take the same To-Do list and implement it using a bunch of different state managers. This time we are looking at MobX!

title: Mastering Typescript State using Zustand
description: Continuing on with Typescript we are starting a series on React state management where we take the same To-Do list and implement it using a bunch of different state managers. This time we are looking at Zustand!

title: Introduction to React #16 | Server Side Rendering (SSR)
description: We take our NextJS app and use Server Side Rendering to render the pages on the server before they go to the client.

title: Live! Mastering Typescript State Management using Redux
description: We continue our series on state management with React and Typescript by looking at how to properly type Redux and Redux Thunk.

title: Mastering Typescript State Management using Redux
description: We continue our series on state management with React and Typescript by looking at how to properly type Redux and Redux Thunk.

title: Fixing Module Federation Versioning
description: Module Federation has made runtime sharing a snap BUT we are still figuring out versioning. Thankfully Jacob Ebey has a pattern for not just versioning, but simple deployment with unpkg as well.

title: Live! Mastering Typescript State Management using just React
description: Continuing on with Typescript we are starting a series on React state management where we take the same To-Do list and implement it using a bunch of different state managers. And to kick that off we are looking at using just the React basics to start; useState, useContext and createContext.

title: Mastering Typescript State Management using just React
description: Continuing on with Typescript we are starting a series on React state management where we take the same To-Do list and implement it using a bunch of different state managers. And to kick that off we are looking at using just the React basics to start; useState, useContext and createContext.

title: Plugins for React Apps - No Really!
description: Can we have the same kind of pluggable modular architecture in Node/React in a similar way as the Java folks have it in their configurable servers? Yes we can using some cool Webpack plugins and Create React App (or honestly anything you want to put it on.) Check it out and let me know what you think!

title: Mastering Typescript for React Hooks - Live!
description: Let's dive DEEP again into Typescript but this time to look at React Hooks.

title: Mastering React Hooks with Typescript
description: Let's dive DEEP again into Typescript but this time to look at React Hooks.

title: Mastering Typescript for React Components - Live!
description: Let's dive DEEP into understanding how to type your React components in Typescript!

title: Typescript for React Components From Beginners to Masters
description: Typescript is quickly becoming the industry standard for React development. Take your Typescript skills from beginner to masters level by learning everything you need to know about how to write components in React the right way.

title: Simplified Micro-Frontends in Vue
description: Vue 3 is a fantastic platform for making Micro-Frontends, let me show you how easy it is to do with Webpack 5's Module Federation functionality!

title: Simplified Micro-Frontends in Vue
description: Vue 3 is a fantastic platform for making Micro-Frontends, let me show you how easy it is to do with Webpack 5's Module Federation functionality!

title: Hacking Amazon's Undocumented React UI Toolkit
description: Lets hack a React app together with Amazon's undocumented UI Toolkit. It's always good to stretch yourself and try something new. Like seeing just how much insight you can get into a React UI toolkit using just the Typescript definitions.

title: Live! | Fixing useContext with react-tracked
description: React's useState/useContext pairing is easy to use but its got performance issues. Let's look at Daishi Kato's react-tracked library and see if we can still use our existing context code, but make it more efficient by only updating components that depend on specific elements of the state tree.

title: Fixing useContext with react-tracked
description: React's useState/useContext pairing is easy to use but its got performance issues. Let's look at Daishi Kato's react-tracked library and see if we can still use our existing context code, but make it more efficient by only updating components that depend on specific elements of the state tree.

title: Introduction to React #15 | NextJS
description: Where we port our application that was built on Create React App to the NextJS framework.

title: Introduction to React #14 | MobX
description: We take our Zustand app and try just one more state manager and that's MobX.

title: Live! - Micro-FEs Simplified
description: Let's use Module Federation to make Micro-Frontends easy!

title: Micro-FEs Simplified
description: Let's use Module Federation to make Micro-Frontends easy!

title: Twin Macro and React 17
description: Let's use Tailwind and Twin.Macro on top of Create React App to build a CSS platform that's not just easy to use and super flexible, but really performant as well.

title: Live! - Conquering Regular Expressions - Part I
description: Let's build our regular expression muscles by practicing regexing some strings to find and filter phone numbers.

title: Conquering Regular Expressions - Part I
description: Let's build our regular expression muscles by practicing regexing some strings to find and filter phone numbers.

title: Live! Introduction to React #13 | Zustand
description: We port our Redux application to the much simpler Zustand state manager.

title: Introduction to React #13 | Zustand
description: We port our Redux application to the much simpler Zustand state manager.

title: Sixel + React = Awesome - Live!
description: Put high resolution graphics right into your terminal using the Sixel standard, Puppeteer, React and some charting libraries.

title: Sixel + React = Awesome
description: Put high resolution graphics right into your terminal using the Sixel standard, Puppeteer, React and some charting libraries.

title: Introduction to React #12 | Redux
description: We port our application to the Redux statement manager to see how that works.

title: Live - Converting to Typescript - Arrays
description: Learn typescript by converting Javascript to Typescript. In this video we start out with basic typing of function arguments and return values, and get to know Typescript tooling.

title: Introducing Valtio - Short Subject
description: Let's check out the Valtio state manager for React.

title: Converting JavaScript to Typescript - Arrays
description: Learn typescript by converting Javascript to Typescript. In this video we start out with basic typing of function arguments and return values, and get to know Typescript tooling.

title: DIY Performance Data Gathering Chrome Extension
description: Let's build a Chrome extension that gathers performance metrics from the pages you browse around then gives you a popup display you can use to compare metrics between competitor sites.

title: Live - Introduction to React #11 | useReducer
description: We learn how to use the useReducer hook instead of the useState hook to store data.

title: Introduction to React #11 | useReducer
description: We learn how to use the useReducer hook instead of the useState hook to store data.

title: Live - Module Federation for NextJS 10
description: Learn how to use Module Federations to export components directly out of your NextJS 10 applications into other NextJS applications. If you are running a micro-site architecture and you want Micro-Frontends, this is a valuable architectural option.

title: Module Federation for NextJS 10
description: Learn how to use Module Federations to export components directly out of your NextJS 10 applications into other NextJS applications. If you are running a micro-site architecture and you want Micro-Frontends, this is a valuable architectural option.

title: Trying Blazor
description: Let's check out Microsoft's new Blazor framework for building web pages using WebAssembly.

title: Live - Converting to Typescript - Objects
description: Learn typescript by converting Javascript to Typescript. In this video we look into typing objects.

title: Converting JavaScript to Typescript - Objects
description: Learn typescript by converting Javascript to Typescript. In this video, we look into typing objects.

title: Live - Converting to Typescript - Basic Types
description: Learn typescript by converting Javascript to Typescript. In this video we start out with basic typing of function arguments and return values, and get to know Typescript tooling.

title: Converting JavaScript to TypeScript - Basic Types
description: Learn typescript by converting Javascript to Typescript. In this video we start out with basic typing of function arguments and return values, and get to know Typescript tooling.

title: Live - Introduction to React #10 | Use Context
description: We learn how to use context to pass data around our React application.

title: Introduction to React #10 | Use Context
description: We learn how to use context to pass data around our React application.

title: Live - Introducing Jotai || React State Manager Tutorial
description: Let's try out the new Jotai state manager.

title: Introducing Jotai || React State Manager Tutorial
description: Let's try out the new Jotai state manager.

title: Live - Vue on Module Federation | Tutorial
description: Learn how to share Vue components, Javascript and data live between applications using the Module Federation system built into Webpack 5.

title: Dog Slider Part 2 || Vanilla JS Tutorial
description: We take our existing static SVG dog slider with overlay, and make it dynamic then connect it to a web service.

title: Vue on Module Federation | Tutorial
description: Learn how to share Vue components, Javascript and data live between applications using the Module Federation system built into Webpack 5.

title: Live - Zustand - New React State Manager
description: Let's try out the Zustand state manager by building a simple application that grabs a list of Pokemon and filter it with a text box. Is Zustand the perfect choice between local component state with prop-drilling and content and a big Redux singleton? Let's find out!

title: Zustand - New React State Manager
description: Let's try out the Zustand state manager by building a simple application that grabs a list of Pokemon and filter it with a text box. Is Zustand the perfect choice between local component state with prop-drilling and content and a big Redux singleton? Let's find out!

title: Live - Module Federation for Plugins || Module Federation Tutorial
description: Let's use Module Federation to create an extensible Dockerized express server!

title: Introduction to React #6 | Asynchronous Requests
description: We dump the data file and instead learn how to load the Pokemon data via a web request using React's useEffect hook and fetch.

title: Module Federation for Plugins || Module Federation Tutorial
description: Let's use Module Federation to create an extensible Dockerized express server!

title: Introduction to React #9 | Class Components
description: We learn how to create a class based component by turning the App component from a function into an ES6 class.

title: Introduction To React #3 | Lists
description: We learn how to load data into our project, as well as how to iterate through arrays to create tables.

title: Introduction to React #5 | State and Events
description: We get our first look at state management and event handling by upgrading our Pokemon list viewer to make it searchable and to give it Pokemon detail view.

title: Introduction To React #2 | JSX
description: We learn how to create HTML in React using the JSX syntax, as well as gotchas around CSS classes and styles.

title: Introduction to React #1 | Deployment
description: Let's start our journey in React by creating a React application then deploying it to Github Pages!

title: Introduction to React #7 | CSS in JS
description: We make our application easier to maintain by using CSS in Javascript and the emotion library.

title: Introduction to React #4 | Creating Components
description: We take our existing Pokemon list application and make it more maintainable by creating a new component to display a row in the table.

title: Introduction to React #8 | Component Libraries
description: We start to get the most out of React by using the Material UI component library to give our application a much cleaner look.

title: Module Federation with Svelte || Module Federation Tutorial
description: Checkout how to do Svelte micro-FEs using Module Federation in Webpack 5 by getting two Svelte apps to talk together then adding a React client as well.

title: Live - Hacking Your Github Contribution Graph || Javascript Tutorial
description: You can make your Github contribution graph look like whatever you want, then take some snaps and put them on Twitter. Or just deploy your re-imagined graph on Github itself using Github Pages! So let's jump in and see how to hack your contribution graph using Vanilla JS.

title: Hacking Your Github Contribution Graph || Javascript Tutorial
description: You can make your Github contribution graph look like whatever you want, then take some snaps and put them on Twitter. Or just deploy your re-imagined graph on Github itself using Github Pages! So let's jump in and see how to hack your contribution graph using Vanilla JS.

title: Typescript with Module Federation || TypeScript Tutorial
description: Let's try out Typescript with Module Federation. Turns out it's not hard. But do you have a better way than me to do this? Let's find out!

title: Typescript with Module Federation ||  TypeScript Tutorial
description: Let's try out Typescript with Module Federation. Turns out it's not hard. But do you have a better way than me to do this? Let's find out!

title: Live: Module Federation Into Production
description: We'll take two different deployed applications and share a header between them using Module Federation.

title: Module Federation Into Production
description: We'll take two different deployed applications and share a header between them using Module Federation.

title: Live: Four GraphQL Clients Compared
description: Let's check out fetch, graphql-request, Apollo Client, and Relay, all on the same server so that you can see for yourself which one is the right one for your project.

title: Four GraphQL Clients Compared
description: Let's check out fetch, graphql-request, Apollo Client, and Relay, all on the same server so that you can see for yourself which one is the right one for your project.

title: XState Pizza Wizard!
description: Check out the state machine builder XState as we build a pizza ordering wizard.

title: XState Pizza Wizard!
description: Check out the state machine builder XState as we build a pizza ordering wizard.

title: Expando Forms in React Hook Forms
description: Learn how to make forms that expand to add new sections dynamically.

title: Expando Forms in React Hook Form
description: Learn how to make forms that expand to add new sections dynamically.

title: Flexible Forms with React Hook Form LIVE!
description: Learn about how to make forms with flexible sections, and also to use Module Federation to load in those form sections via dependency injection.

title: Flexible Forms with React Hook Form
description: Learn about how to make forms with flexible sections, and also to use Module Federation to load in those form sections via dependency injection.

title: Module Federation in NextJS Today! Live!
description: What if you could have Module Federation in NextJS today? Or in any Webpack 4 application! Learn how and ask questions as we go!

title: Module Federation in NextJS Today!
description: Learn all about how to use Module Federation, both to expose components and to consume components, with NextJS as it stands today on WebPack 4.

title: Module Federation on Rollup!
description: Who wants to learn about using Module Federation in Rollup? I do! So we've got Zack Jackson and Jacob Ebey on to talk about it and lead us all through getting it set up.

title: LIVE! A/B tests in Module Federation
description: Build A/B test code, a statically deployed A/B test manager and figure out how to do unit testing with Federated Modules, all in on video!

title: A/B tests in Module Federation
description: Build A/B test code, a statically deployed A/B test manager and figure out how to do unit testing with Federated Modules, all in on video!

title: LIVE! How to build a resilient shared Header/Footer using Module Federation
description: What's the one thing you need to share between micro-site applications? The Header and the Footer. So how do we share them so that they live update across all of the sites when deployed, but safe enough so that the code intelligently falls back on a functional older version in the case of an issue.

title: Full Site Federation
description: Now that you know about the basics of Module Federation in Webpack 5 let's convert an entire micro-site based architecture to a fully federated site. Live! With your questions answered as we go!

title: How to build a resilient shared Header/Footer using Module Federation
description: What's the one thing you need to share between micro-site applications? The Header and the Footer. So how do we share them so that they live update across all of the sites when deployed, but safe enough so that the code intelligently falls back on a functional older version in the case of an issue.

title: Getting Started with Module Federation
description: Learn all about this exciting new way to share code between web applications. This is a code level walkthrough where you get to ask all the questions you like along the way.

title: Getting Started with Module Federation
description: Learn all about this exciting new way to share code between web applications. This is a code level walkthrough where you get to ask all the questions you like along the way.

title: Full Site Federation in Webpack 5
description: When we moved from monoliths to micro-sites we lost out on easy code sharing, single page applications, and it made it much harder to end-to-end test, and to understand the system as a whole. See how Module Federation brings all that back while still maintaining the ability to independently deploy applications.

title: Live Preview in CMS with Module Federation
description: See for yourself how two applications, a CMS admin application, and a customer facing rendering application (that also supports editing) are brought together, sharing code live, using Webpack 5's Module Federation functionality.

title: Introducing Module Federation
description: Let's take five minutes to get to know Module Federation, a new code sharing technique that makes it easy to share code between micro-site teams.

title: Recoil; The Best Micro-FE/Mod-Fed State Manager?
description: Let's check out Recoil and see how handles state management in a Micro-FE/Module Federation application space.

title: Federate Module Dashboard
description: Let's use Webpack 5's Federated Modules, along with Recoil, Emotion and react-minimal-pie-chart to make a dashboard that's build on top of a vanilla create-react-app application. It's so cool! Let's do this!

title: Build A K K Slider Slider
description: Let's use Framer Motion on React to create a swipeable carousel for K K Slider album covers!

title: CSR, SSR, and SSG on NextJS
description: Let's take a single app and build it three ways, with client side rendering (CSR), server side rendering (SSR) and static site generation (SSG) all using NextJS 9.3.

title: React Refresh in CRA in 5 minutes
description: Hot module reloading is so ... 2015(?) ... There is a better way and it's coming soon.

title: NextJS on Heroku with React-Query and Squirrel Picnic Tables
description: Let's learn how to deploy NextJS on Heroku, with APIs, using React-Query to make a non-sensical application around Squirrel Picnic tables, because, why not?

title: React Hook Form - React Forms Episode II
description: Let's get back into forms and look at your recommendation `react-hook-form`!

title: Yarn 2 (Berry) - Plug'n'play, Constraints and Workspaces
description: Let's check out Yarn v2 and its amazing new features. There's plug-n-play loading for node modules that gives you much better loading performance. And there are constraints that can manage your dependencies across your projects.

title: Comparing Plain React, Formik and Final Form for forms
description: Forms managers; formik and final-form, are they better than just using React directly? Let's find out!

title: Tech A Day #31 - VanillaJS
description: Closing out the Tech A Day series with a VanillaJS search application for Rifftrax movies.

title: Tech A Day #30 - GraphQL
description: Learn all about creating a GraphQL aggregation server and putting a UI on it by creating a rescue dog site!

title: Tech A Day #28 - Vue
description: Let's check out Vue by building an Animal Crossing New Horizons pricing search page.

title: Tech A Day #29 - RxJS
description: Let's check out how to make observable streams with RxJS!

title: Tech A Day #27 - Design Tokens
description: Four different ways to have design tokens that you can adjust and change the look of your site, consistently, from a single spot, in both CSS and React.

title: Tech A Day #26 - Storybook
description: Show off your components, and even get insights into rendering performance using a new addon from Atlassian.

title: Tech A Day #25 - Closures
description: Understanding closures is critical to becoming the best Javascript engineer. Let me introduce them to you in a very practical way.

title: Tech A Day #24 - Strings
description: There is soooo much you can do with Javascript strings, let's check it out!

title: Tech A Day #23 - NextJS 9.3
description: NextJS has come out with the 9.3 release that allows for static site generation. It's a trifecta; client side rendering, server side render, and static site generation, all in one framework. It's amazing stuff, let's check it out.

title: Tech A Day #22 - Dates
description: Do you really need moment? Let's find out as we delve deep into Date objects.

title: Tech A Day #21 - Functions
description: Let's jump into the different ways to define, call, reflect and extend functions.

title: Tech A Day #20 - Objects
description: We've done an in-depth look at arrays. Let's have a look at all the myriad of things you can do with a Javascript "Object". And spoiler alert, it's a lot.

title: URQL for GraphQL - Part 2
description: Let's finish up our URQL and GraphQL Yoga based chat app by making it subscriptions and websockets based.

title: Tech A Day #19 - Electron Soundboard
description: Build a soundboard with canned answers for boring video conferences.

title: Tech A Day #18 - Deno
description: Check out the possible successor to node; deno!

title: Tech A Day #17 - Gatsby
description: As per your request, three ways to make pages in Gatsby!

title: Tech A Day #16 - GraphQL in Memory
description: Why settle for Redux to manage your data when you could just use GraphQL in memory? Crazy? Maybe. But an interesting experiment none the less.

title: Tech A Day #15 - Next JS + SSR
description: Let's start a NextJS project, then get it to SSR pages using data from a GraphQL server using our new friend #urql.

title: DIY Virus Simulator
description: Learn about how to make a virus simulator using React, SVG, Quadtrees and requestAnimationFrame.

title: URQL for GraphQL - Part 1
description: Let's check out the URQL client library for GraphQL and use it to make a chat app.

title: Tech A Day #13 - Prettier and ESLint
description: Let's get a project set up with ESLint and Prettier working happily together and integrated into VS Code.

title: Tech A Day #12 - Playroom
description: Want to show off your component and let people hack together POCs interactively? Playroom might be just what you are looking for.

title: Tech A Day #11 - Neumorphic Design
description: Learn about the design trend of Neumorphism, what it is, how it relates to where we are now and other design trends, and have a quick look at a React library that implements a few neumorphic components.

title: Tech A Day #10 - GSAP
description: Check out this gooey droplets loader that uses a combination of SVG graphics and GSAP animations to make a really cool loader effect.

title: Tech A Day #9 - Svelte
description: Svelte is sooo cool. A framework-less framework that makes it easy to build component oriented UI code that works fast and has a minuscule bundle size.

title: Tech A Day #8 - Snowpack
description: Want a fast ecmascript module based development flow. Check out how easy it is to get preact set up with Snowpack, and try it yourself!

title: K D Tree + D&D = Pretty Cool
description: Let's make a monster finder using a K-D tree algorithm, React and Material-UI.

title: Tech A Day #7 - GQLess in 5 minutes
description: Check out this lightweight way to query from a GraphQL server, in just five minutes!

title: Tech a day #6 - Streaming JSON
description: You want to parse through a ton of JSON data, but you don't want to load it all into memory. How do you do that?

title: Tech A Day #5 - AlpineJS
description: Let's check out AlpineJS, a super lightweight way to add interactivity to a web page!

title: Tech A Day #4 - Debugging
description: Let's talk about debugging and building better tested Javascript in general.

title: Tech A Day #3 - Tailwind CSS
description: Get to know this cool pluggable utility based CSS framework!

title: Tech A Day #2 - Linaria
description: Treat yourself to some no-runtime CSS in JS today!

title: Tech A Day #1 - RedwoodJS
description: While we have this time, let's make ourselves better engineers, by learning about a new tech topic every day! Starting today with RedwoodJS.

title: Single Spa + Federated Modules = Wow!
description: What do you get when you put Single Spa and Federated Modules in Webpack 5 together? Any framework on any app in a way that makes it much easier to maintain.

title: Introducing Module Federation in Webpack 5
description: Want to share code dynamically between web applications but don't want to use libraries or custom Micro-FE frameworks. Check out what's in store for you with Webpack 5 and how federated modules will fundamentally change how you view web applications.

title: True dynamic loaded components in React
description: Learn how to use Ecmascript modules, Rollup and externalized globals to make a truly independently deployable component framework.

title: Javascript Modules in detail - Part 3
description:
Let's finish up our Javascript modules based DIY Micro-FE example (phew, that's a mouthful) by turning one of the Micro-FEs into a React App.

This will show you how to use Snowpack to develop a Javascript/Ecmascript module based React App.

title: Micro-Frontends: What, why and how
description: Find out all about Micro Frontends at the high level. Why are they interesting? What are the advantages and disadvantages? And how would you get started in moving your site into a Micro-FE architecture.

title: Javascript Modules in detail - Part 2
description: Let's learn about asynchronous Javascript module loading by turning our simple JS application into a Micro-FE application by creating our own Micro-FE framework and porting the code to it. This will teach you everything you need to know about practical use of Javascript modules.

title: Javascript Modules in detail - Part 1
description: Learn about Javascript modules by making a simple modules based e-Commerce UI. In part 2 we'll refactor the modules into micro-fe's and load them on demand. And in the third video we will migrate one of the modules to react using Snowpack.

title: Svelte and Scones!
description: Learn how to do simple data binding in Svelte, and also how to cook scones on this hybrid cooking/coding show.

title: Multithreading in Javascript Using Worker Threads
description: Find out how to using Worker Threads in Javascript to multi-thread your app and get amazing performance boosts. This is a practical video, we walk through taking traditional single threaded code and porting it to multithreading.

title: Webpack, Rollup and Parcel Compared
description: Let's build a React app using Webpack, Rollup and Parcel to compare these three bundlers.

title: JAMStack Overview
description: A high level walkthrough of JAMStack so you can decide if this new way of developing and deploying web applications is the right choice for your project.

title: Edge Side Includes for Micro-FEs
description: Learn how to use Edge Side Includes (ESI) in your Micro-Frontend solutions.

title: Parcel Even Easier
description: Parcel is even better and easier than I originally thought.

title: Time Travel Debugging with Wallaby
description: Check out Wallabys new time travel debugging mode.

title: Micro-FEs in Zoid
description: Zoinks scoop! Lets jump in the van in figure out the mystery of a micro-FE framework built on iFrames.

title: DIY Micro-FE Framework
description: Havent found a Micro-FE framework that works for you? Lets build one!

title: Fetching Data in React Concurrent Mode
description: Learn about how to use concurrent mode to give your users better feedback on asynchronous operations.

title: React To Vanilla JS
description: Learn about porting a React app to vanilla JS.

title: Vanilla JS for React Developers
description: Just know React and now you want to learn how to code without it, directly to the browser? Come along and find out.

title: All About Parcel
description: Learn about my new favorite bundler Parcel and how its zero configuration bundling can make building sites a breeze.

title: JSX For VanillaJS
description: Using JSX to create vanillaJS components the literate way.

title: Before and After Sliders in Svelte
description: Use Svelte to create an interactive before and after slider using CSS and clip-path.

title: Custom Elements in Svelte
description: Learn how to turn your Svelte components into custom elements in four easy steps.

title: Custom Elements in React From Scratch
description: Put your cool React components on any web page by turning them into custom elements.

title: CSS Isolation using the Shadow DOM Quick Take
description: Using the Shadow DOM for CSS isolation outside of the context of a custom element.

title: React Drops using Immer
description: Find out how to use Immer to manage the state of a simple 2D puzzle game to React.

title: Web Components for Micro Frontends
description: Find out how to build custom elements in Vue, React and vanilla JS, and how to use them as a Micro Frontend framework.

title: Micro Frontends using Single SPA
description: Learn about how to create Micro frontends using Single SPA by building a product detail page.

title: Micro Frontends using OpenComponents
description: Learn more about Micro Frontends using, implemented using OpenComponents, with an example Product Detail Page.

title: Deno Deploy: Crazy Fast Cloud Functions - Architecture Speedun
description: Let's try out Deno Deploy and see just how fast it can be to make cloud functions and deploy cloud based UI using the Javascript and Typescript skills you already have

title: Cleaning Up Copilot Code (Human vs AI) - maxChar
description: GitHub Copilot is a great helper, but you it's just the copilot. Let's take the pilot's chair and turn some not so great Copilot code and turn it into high quality production ready TypeScript code.

title: Five Module Federation/Micro-Frontend Mistakes
description: Module Federation is an advanced front-end topic, that's for sure, so let's talk about some mistakes that people make, and misconceptions people have, about the this Webpack 5 functionality, as well as how to avoid them.

title: Test Driven Development: The best way to code that I almost never use
description: Test Driven Development is a fantastic way to build code that you know is well tested and will work. I know I should code this way, but why don't I? Let's find out what Test Driven Development is, and see if you should give it a try as we apply it to basic JavaScript and TypeScript functions, custom React hooks and React components.

title: GraphQL/JWT Speed Run with Refresh Tokens
description: In just thirty minutes learn how to get JSON Web Token authentication running in GraphQL using refresh tokens, Axios and React Query!

title: Senior Developer Workflow For Stress-Free Coding
description: Stop being frustrated with your code and take just a few minutes to learn an iterative workflow. Your code will always be working. Your stress level will be low. You'll be able to go for a lunch or a run and not worry about how to fix your broken code. And you'll be able to locate bugs down to just a few lines without doing extensive debugging.

title: Command & Memento Patterns in Typescript (No BS TS Series 2 Episode 4)
description: Let's have a look at the Command and Memento Design Patterns in TypeScript and see how to implement Undo, and time-travel state management the easy way. We even build out a custom hook that adds undo functionality to useState!

title: Redux Toolkit Query vs React Query
description: Picking an API access library for your React app is tough, there are so many great choices! Let's take a look at two of the most popular; React Query and Redux Toolkit Query.

title: Micro-Frontends in Just 10 Minutes
description: Take ten minutes to create three applications using Module Federation to create and share a Micro-Frontend between SolidJS and React.

title: Svelte, URQL, Apollo Speed Run
description: We build a CMS application fast that connects Svelte to an Apollo server using URQL and the GraphQL Code Generator.

title: Redux Sagas vs Redux Toolkit Query
description: Redux Saga and Redux Toolkit Query are two great ways to do API access. Let's compare them head to head doing full create, read, update and delete operations on both libraries. If you've only seen one of these in action you'll want to check this out!

title: Visitor and Iterator Patterns in TypeScript (No BS TS Series 2 Episode 3)
description: In this third episode of No BS TS series 2 we look at the Visitor & Iterator patterns. These patterns allow you to decouple complex traversal code from computation code. For example you can decoupling paging through an API from the code that does computations on the data returned from the API.

title: TypeScript Pub/Sub Patterns (No BS TS Series 2 Episode 2)
description: In this second episode of No BS TS series 2 we look at the Publish & Subscribe pattern (or the Observer pattern as they call it in the book). This pattern allows you to loosen the coupling in your code and maximize reuse, all while making your code easier to understand.

title: Nobody Wins A Programmer Fight
description: Healthy debate about things like React versus Vue, OOP versus FP, strongly typed versus dynamically typed is fine, but sometimes it can get ugly. So let's talk about how to mitigate the fallout from a technical debate that gets too heated.

title: TypeScript/React Testing: Components, Hooks, Custom Hooks, Redux and Zustand
description: By viewer request we are looking at testing React TypeScript components all the way from render components, through components with state, asynchronous components, custom hooks, Redux and Zustand.

title: TypeScript Factory Patterns (No BS TS Series 2 Episode 1)
description: No BS TS is back! With the first in an all new series where we cover all the patterns in the original Design Patterns book (and more). This time we are looking at the factory patterns; Abstract Factory, Builder and Factory Method. All of these patterns help you build reusable well architected code.

title: Find A GPU You Like With a KD-Tree and React
description: Having trouble finding the GPU you want in stock? Maybe another one is just as good. Let's write an app that helps you find which GPUs are a similar match to that GPU you crave.

title: Ponicode: AI-driven unit testing
description: Let's check out Ponicode, an AI driven unit test writer. Whether you are a unit test noobie who wants to learn to write tests, or a seasoned veteran who wants to up their unit test coverage numbers, there is something in Ponicode to like!

title: React + RxJS = Reactive Global Goodness
description: Let's fuse together React and RxJS to build a Pokemon deck builder application and use that as an opportunity to learn about RxJS and how it can play nicely with React.

title: Avoid Bad Job Fits with Five Interviewer Questions
description: YOU get to ask questions during the interview, but so many folks don't use that opportunity to ask real questions that will weed out the bad jobs.

title: Fixing TypeScript's Blindspot: Runtime Typechecking
description: TypeScript only checks types at compile time. And that means that, invalid data, that doesn't have the fields we think are required, can still break our applications. Learn how to use Zod, Yup, and Joi to fix this problem and go even further to check the contents of the fields at runtime.

title: Solid + GraphQL = Realtime Magic
description:
[NOTE: Apparently my point that Apollo is hard bound to React is wrong. I'll be looking into that.]

Let's use the Solid-JS framework to create a todo app using queries, mutations and subscriptions. Then, in a quick twist, we repurpose the todo app into a chat app.

title: Mastering async code with Typescript and Javascript
description: Async code can be some of the hardest code to write in Typescript and Javascript, and we write it all the time. So let's build up some patterns for writing async/await code well, doing multiple stacked async calls, testing our async code, using promises for caching, and even supporting old school callbacks.

title: Five ways to beat burnout
description: Let's talk about what burnout is and how we can practically address it both personally and with changes at work.

title: ESBuild and SWC: Worth your time?
description: Is the juice worth the squeeze with these new JS/TS compilers written in Go and Rust? We'll take a look at compiling libraries, as well as several different variations on compiling web applications using Create React App, NextJS, Webpack and Rollup.

title: React vs SolidJS, Fight!
description: Let's compare React with the upstart newcomer Solid-JS in an eCommerce showdown!

title: Why Typescript?
description: Let's talk about the advantages of Typescript and why you'd want to use it.

title: Will Github Copilot Take Your Job?
description: Lets look at Github's controversial Copilot extension for VS Code. I'll show you how to sign up, how to work with it, and talk advice and ethics.

title: Angular Module Federation Micro-FE Speed Run
description: We use NX to build two Angular applications using PrimeNG, then share a component between the two applications using module federation.

title: You're Doing React Hooks Wrong, Probably
description: Let's see how to get the most our of React hooks by using them as a reactive state management system by making proper use of the dependency arrays with useEffect, useMemo and useCallback.

title: No BS TS 34 - Typescript Decorators
description: We're back with one more No BS TS and this time we are looking at Typescript Decorators; how to make them, how to use them.

title: Top Tech Trends For Web Developers in 2022
description: So much cool stuff is happening in the development space right now, let me tell you what I'm tracking in 2022.

title: Is JavaScript Spread a Performance Killer? Quick Fix
description: Using spreading with Array.reduce is a powerful pattern, but it can also be a performance killer. Let's learn what causes the performance issues and how to get around it while still keeping the same powerful functionality.

title: JavaScript consts Aren't Constants - JavaScript Quick Fix
description: Does JavaScript treat constant arrays and objects the same way as numbers, strings, and booleans? Turns out not. So let's see why that is and how, if you don't understand it, you can easily put bugs into your React applications.

title: JavaScript's Most Controversial Array Methods (Part 6)
description: Let's take a look at the destructive array methods in JavaScript: push, pop, shift, unshift, sort, reverse, splice and copyWithin.

title: Reduce: Mother of all Javascript Array Methods? (Part 5)
description: Reduce is considered the hardest of the Array functions, is it? Let's try demystifying this super powerful Array method and give you the power to create anything you want from an arry.

title: Javascript Arrays Made Simple: Map and Flat (Part 4)
description: Map is probably the most important single array method you will learn, particularly if you are a React developer. Let's dig into the powerful map method, and its associated methods to see just what we can do with them.

title: Remix Run Speedrun - Pokemon
description: Is Remix Run more than just hype? Lets find out by building out a multi-page Pokemon SPA to show you a bunch of the fundamentals: SSR data loading, Navigation, API Routes, page routes and parameters, and more.

title: Javascript Arrays Made Simple: Filter and Slice (Part 3)
description: Filter is a critical array method to memorize in JavaScript. Filter will help you pair down your arrays to just the items that interest you in an intuitive and fast way. Learn all about the filter and slice methods in this video and get your arrays under control.

title: Javascript Arrays Made Simple: Indexing and Finding (Part 2)
description: Lets dig into array methods like find, findIndex, includes, some, every and more to see how JavaScript helps us find out what is in our arrays.

title: Javascript Arrays Made Simple: Iterators (Part 1)
description: Let's have a look at all the different ways to iterate through arrays; for, for(in), for(of) and forEach and figure out which ones you should use, and which you should NOT use.

title: Proxy & Flyweight Patterns - No BS TS Series 2 Episode 5
description: We learn how to use the Proxy Design Pattern (and the Proxy object in JavaScript) to listen to key gets and sets in order to create on-demand hydrated objects (Flyweights) and a MobX style state manager.

title: React Location: Better than React Router?
description: React Router has been the best in class router for years now. But now the creator of React Query, Tanner Linsley, has developed and just released a new router for the Tanstack named React Location. Declarative routing? Check. Asynchronous route loading? Got it. Easy data pre-loading? Absolutely. This library is a blast and it works on both the client and the server. So let's give it a try.

title: Fixing Bad Copilot Code - mergeArrays
description: GitHub Copilot code is often amazing and sometimes terrifying. Let's take a O(N^3) mergeArrays implementation and turn it into a sleek O(N) ES6 near one liner, step by step.
